Articles.Content:
Hi,

I'm a newbie who begins playing KSP three months ago. I'm on macOS High Sierra with KSP 1.4.3.

I begun the game with the science mode and now I would like to try the career mode but... I'm lazy, so I would like to find the spacecrafts, probes, satellites and rovers I build during the science mod without recreate the all world again.

How can I download them in the career mode ? Where can I find them in the KSP's folders ?

Thank you for helping

 

Lopo

I'm on Windows, but I'm pretty sure it would work the same way on Mac.

1) Locate you KSP folder

2) Open the save folder

3) Open the folder with the name of the save where your ships are (the science one)

4) Open the Ships folder

5) Open either the SPH or VAB folder, depending on which building you built your spacecraft in.

6) Copy the .craft file of the ship you want to copy (file name will be the name you gave your ship)

7) Paste the .craft file in the corresponding folder of your target save (the career one)!

The ships will be available in your new save, but you're gonna have to unlock the parts.

Edited June 6, 2018 by Gilead

2 hours ago, Gilead said:

I'm on Windows, but I'm pretty sure it would work the same way on Mac.

1) Locate you KSP folder

2) Open the save folder

3) Open the folder with the name of the save where your ships are (the science one)

4) Open the Ships folder

5) Open either the SPH or VAB folder, depending on which building you built your spacecraft in.

6) Copy the .craft file of the ship you want to copy (file name will be the name you gave your ship)

7) Paste the .craft file in the corresponding folder of your target save (the career one)!

The ships will be available in your new save, but you're gonna have to unlock the parts.

It was clear and easy to follow! Thank you very much!

And yes, same structure on Mac.
